ko: 니콜라스는 무심결에 그동안 궁금했던 것을 질문했다.
en: Nicholas unconsciously asked something he had been curious about.
The secret to looking young?
Regular lifestyle and sleeping at 10 PM?
(Lies. He's busy until dawn every day...)
Father
What?

en: You're just making excuses to dump work on me

ko: 쓰읍. 아이니까, 투덜댈 시간에 가서 일이나 봐라.
en: Ha! Don't be like that, go and do the work instead of complaining.
Let's talk to Vash in the garden
Fresh and green
Plant seeds in the field
Find Wolfwood who went to the village
Water the geranium flower bed
This should be enough.
Let's ask mother what to do next
Return to Vash
Should I plant\ncherry tomatoes next?

ko: 꽃을 볼 수 있는\n지오 플랜트는 귀여워~
en: The geoplant with\n visible flowers is cute~
A turtle couple\nappeared?!
So cute~\nEat lots and lots~!
Handsome.
A toast filled with Vash's love.
Love, yes—flavor, not so much.
Clothes scattered in a mess.

ko: 청소하지 않으면 한 소리 들을게 뻔하다.
en: I'll definitely get scolded if I don't clean up.
But I won't clean it up.
I’m going through my rebellious phase.
Should I organize the clothes?
I should organize before getting scolded.
Well... maybe tomorrow...
That's a wise choice.
Alright, let's finish the remaining tasks
Spikey!!!

ko: 고요한 저택에서는 아무 대답이 돌아오지 않는다..
en: No response came from the quiet mansion..
Damn... Am I too late..?

ko: 니콜라스는 허무한 말과 함께 들고 있던 제라늄 꽃을 놓쳤다.
en: Nicholas let the geranium slip from his hand as he muttered hollow words.
If only I could turn back time…
Go to Livio's workshop

ko: 마을의 끝에 있는 리비오의 목공소로 가자!
en: Let's go to Livio's workshop at the end of the village!
Return home
Let's return to the house where my parents are waiting

ko: 이때나 지금이나 변한 게 없는 것 같다.
en: Nothing seems to have changed from then to now.
I’ve got to tell Stampede how I feel before he leaves!
Prepare geranium flowers
Return to the room and find the ring
Run to Stampede's mansion

ko: 이럴 때가 아냐! 더 늦기 전에 스탬피드를 만나러 가야 해!!
en: No time for this! I need to go meet Stampede before it's too late!!

ko: 검은색 정장 몇 벌과 모노톤의 옷 몇 벌이 가지런히 정리되어 있다.
en: Several black suits and monotone clothes are neatly arranged.

ko: 빨간색 옷으로 가득 차 있다. ... 지겨울 정도로.
en: It's full of red clothes. ...To a boring extent.

ko: 성경과 관련된 서류들이 널브러져 있다. 아멘.
en: Bible-related documents are scattered around. Amen.

ko: 침대 아래에 떨어진 빨간색 코트 자락이 보인다.
en: I can see the hem of a red coat fallen under the bed.
Well the parents will clean it up themselves.
It's a vase with geraniums.

ko: 오늘 아침 물을 준 모양인지 이슬이 맺혀있다.
en: It looks like it was watered this morning—there are still drops of water on it.
A single chair for reading.

ko: 엄마한테 대들때 마다 생각 의자로 썼었다...
en: I used it as a ‘thinking chair’ whenever I talked back to mom...
It's never actually been used for reading.
It's a pot with geraniums.
It seems to have been grown for a very long time.

ko: 우리 집은 왜 허구한 날 제라늄만 키우는 걸까?
en: Why is it always geraniums with mother?
Loafers received as a birthday gift at age 15.
Spikey praised them saying they were pretty.
Geranium.
LOVE & PEACE!
It's a field that my parents are growing as a hobby.

ko: 많은 시행착오가 있었지만 결과는 성공적으로 보인다.
en: There were many trials and errors but the results look successful.
Will it make it to the dinner table?
It's not big but it's a clean pond.

ko: 부모님 친구분들이 놀러 올 때 세미 피크닉이 열리곤 한다.
en: Picnics are held when my parents' friends come to visit.
...I remember them as a very tall person and a short person.
A pot with a blackened bottom.
Someone must have failed at cooking again..
It's full of donuts.
Red couch.

ko: 슬슬 다른 색으로 바꿀 때가 되지 않았나, 파란 소파를 추천했더니 엄마가 기겁하셨다.
en: Isn't it time to change to a different color? When I recommended a blue couch, mom was shocked.
What are you doing, not speeding?
(He's not even thinking of hiding it...)
Give me my task note
You took it yesterday
Look carefully. Like on the desk.
Did I..?
You likes burnt bread too?

ko: 칠을 새로 하였는지 페인트 냄새가 난다.
en: There's a paint smell as if it was newly painted.

ko: 앗, 저 위에 사는 집 아이 아니니?
en: Oh, aren't you the child from the house up there?

ko: 정말 언제 보아도 그 집 남편분과 똑 닮았네~
en: You really look exactly like Wolfwood every time I see you~

ko: 아...예. (이런 얘긴 귀에 딱지가 앉을 만큼 들은 것 같다.)
en: Ah...yes. (I feel like I've heard this story so many times my ears are numb.)

ko: 생각이 많을 때 누군가와 상담하기 좋아 보인다.
en: It looks like a good place to consult with someone when you have a lot on your mind.
Game console.
I received it as a gift from Stampede when I was around 7.

ko: 스탬피드에게 격투 게임 대전을 300번쯤 지고 난 뒤론 켜지 않고 있다...
en: It hasn't been turned on since losing about 300 fighting game matches to Stampede...
Hmm.. where did that go..
When did he get so big...?
He was cute when he was young..
(Gasp..) what should I do..?
Hmm hmm...
Did I order too much..?
Welcome~!
(Sigh...)
I should go to the woodshop.
It's convenient to have raised son well.
Grow big and strong~
Rem would have liked this if she saw this..
There was a sound of heavy metal falling.
...? Is this a revolver?

ko: 와 집에 이런 게 있는 기고..?
en: Why there's something like this at home..?
Oh, Nicholas..! You were home~!
The cookies turned out really well today!

ko: 스탬피드는 라탄 바구니를 한 팔에 안고 있다. 살포시 덮인 흰 천 아래로 산더미처럼 쌓인 쿠키가 보인다.
en: Stampede is holding a rattan basket in one arm. Cookies piled like a mountain can be seen under the lightly covered white cloth.
I brought them to share with everyone!
Good thing I came when Nicholas had time.
Um, right.. thank you..

ko: 두 사람이 머쓱하게 웃으며 마주 본 채로 조용한 시간이 흘렀다.
en: They smiled awkwardly at each other as quiet time passed.

ko: 적당히 말문을 열지 못해 식은땀이 날 때쯤 뒤에서 불쑥 밧슈가 나타났다.
en: When they couldn't find words to say and cold sweat was forming Vash suddenly appeared from behind.
Oh my! Did you bring a gift, Stampede?!
Oh, hello! Vash..!

ko: 스탬피드는 화들짝 놀라며 안고 있던 쿠키 바구니를 쏟을 뻔했다.
en: Stampede was startled and almost spilled the cookie basket he was holding.
Well, let me see Stampede's handiwork?

ko: 밧슈는 니콜라스 옆으로 손을 뻗어 쿠키를 집어 든다.
en: Vash reaches next to Nicholas and picks up a cookie.
Wait, wait…!!

ko: 니콜라스가 끼어들 틈도 없이 쿠키를 양 볼 가득 물고 우물대고 있었다.
en: Before Nicholas could intervene Vash was already chewing with both cheeks full of cookies.

ko: 오~ 아가씨 수제 쿠키가? 우리 빗자루보다 훨씬 나아 보이는데?!
en: Oh- your homemade cookies? They look much better than MY Spikey's!

ko: 울프우드도 쿠키를 한웅큼 집어 든다. 바구니가 순식간에 비어갔다.
en: Wolfwood also grabs a handful of cookies. The basket emptied in an instant.

ko: 맞다. 마, 메느리 삼을 사람 부러워갖꼬 우짜노?
en: Right. Well, I'm envious of someone who would take you as a daughter-in-law.
T-thank you..
(Why are you being so shy..!! What's this..!!!)
Then I'll be going now..!
Nicholas, please let me know how the cookies were..!
(We’ve still got a long way to go…)
What are you doing, hurry up and clean the storage.
(Just wait and see...)
Clean storage room
The storage room is.. right above my room.

ko: 안 치운지 10년도 더 된 것 같은디..
en: It feels like it hasn't been cleaned for over 10 years..

ko: 여는 아부지 어무이가 치우겠다 몇 년째 장담만 했었재.. 여전히 꼬락서니가 말이 아니네.
en: Wolfwood and Vash have been promising to clean it for years.. It's still a mess.
Nicholas let out a deep sigh.
I need equipment to repair it.

ko: 아재네 가서 연장 좀 빌려야 쓰겄네.
en: I need to go to the uncle's woodshop and borrow some tools.
Examine the storage room
Wow, look at the state of the floor.

ko: 이래가 정리는커녕 빡스 들고 댕기다 다리 뿐지르것다.
en: I'll break my leg carrying boxes instead of clean.

ko: 아재네 가서 연장 좀 빌려야 쓰것네.
en: I need to go to the uncle's woodshop and borrow some tools.
Borrow equipment from [Livio's Woodshop]
Did uncle Livio go on a business trip?

ko: 니콜라스는 고민 없이 수리 도구를 챙겼다.
en: Nicholas took the repair tools without hesitation.
...I'm borrowing this for a second
Press Confirm key at the right timing!

ko: 망가진 바닥에 못질을 훌륭하게 해낸다면 수리 성공!
en: If you nail the broken floor perfectly the repair will be successful!
I'll show my skills.
Hammer the nail at just the right moment!
Should I fix this floor?
Should I move this box?
Should we get rid of this cradle?
Phew, they said to move the boxes too.
This will be done quickly.
…Well, he hasn’t changed a bit since then.
Nicholas carefully put away the [photo].
Uncle Livio?
Hmm, it looks good now that it's fixed.
Ugh... it's not as easy as I thought..

ko: 어렸을 때부터 보았던 기억이 있는 짐더미
en: A pile of stuff I remember seeing since childhood

ko: 빗자루랑 숨바꼭질할 때 은폐물로 유용히 써먹었었지
en: I used it as cover when playing hide and seek with Spikey
Heh.. this is easy!
Hmm.. let me catch my breath.

ko: 박스 틈 사이에서 사진 한 장이 떨어졌다.
en: A photo fell from between the boxes.
Wow~ the room became sparkling clean!

ko: 창고로 쓰는 게 아니라 세를 줘도 되겠는걸?
en: Instead of using it as storage we could rent it out?
Who are you planning to let in?
Well..? Livio perhaps?
Uncle isn't married?
Oh my, did he seem to have someone good?
They awkwardly left the storage room
Gardening geraniums

ko: 꽃은 내 잘 몰라가, 어무이한테 물어봐야것다.
en: I don't know much about flowers, I should ask mother.
At this time Vash must be in the field.
Talk to Vash in the field

ko: 어서 와, 니코~ 울프우드가 맡긴 일은 잘 되어가?
en: Welcome, Nico~ How's the task Wolfwood gave you going?

ko: 예, 와 갑자기 이런 걸 시키는 지는 모르겠네예.
en: Well, I don't know why he suddenly gave me this kind of task.

ko: 우후후, 전부 니코를 위한 일이지 않을까?
en: Hehe, isn't it all for Nico's sake?
I don't think so...
Come on, you need to plant flowers anyway?
These are geranium seeds. Take them!
Obtained [Geranium Seed Pouch].

ko: 제라늄은 어떤 계절에도 꽃을 피울 수 있는 강한 식물이야.
en: Geraniums are strong plants that can bloom in any season.
The flower’s meaning is ‘determination.’ It fits perfectly, doesn’t it?

ko: 오늘 심는다고 당장 자라서 꽃이 피진 않겠지만..
en: Just because you plant them today doesn't mean they'll grow and bloom right away..

ko: 혹시 모르지, 니코의 사랑을 담는다면 기적이 일어날지도?
en: Who knows, maybe a miracle will happen if you put your love into it?

ko: 예예, 그케 말 안 해도 쎄 빠지게 심을 낍니더~
en: Yeah yeah, even if you don't say that I'll plant them quickly~
So cold… Nico’s gone and turned into a grown-up...

ko: 아무튼, 씨앗은 손으로 땅을 살짝 판 후에 심으면 돼.
en: Anyway, you can plant the seeds after digging the ground lightly with your hands.
There's a field on the left side of the house.

ko: 한가득 제라늄 꽃이 피면 아주 멋질 거야!
en: It'll be wonderful when the geranium flowers bloom all over!
Let me know when you're done planting!
Should I plant seeds here?
I buried the seeds well.
You finished quickly! Good job, Nico~
Is it done now?

ko: 응? 당연히 씨앗이 깨어날 수 있게 물도 줘야지!
en: Huh? Of course you need to water them so the seeds can sprout!

ko: 아 맞지예..고럼 물뿌리개 좀 줘 보이소.
en: Ah right.. then please give me a watering can.
Yes, that's what we need to do, but the thing is~
(I have a bad feeling about this...)

ko: 아침에 엄마가 밭에 물을 주다가 그만 나무뿌리에 걸려 넘어졌는데
en: This morning I was watering the field and tripped over a tree root
The watering can spout broke right off!
So I asked Wolfwood to fix it
He said he needed materials we don't have at home and took it away!
Why are my worst hunches always right…?
Huh? What did you say Nico?
Oh, nothing. Then where is father?

ko: 울프우드는 아마 마을로 갔을 거야! 한 번 찾아가봐!
en: Wolfwood probably went to the village! Go look for him!
Yes.. I'll go and come back.

ko: 연못에 가재를 키우는 거 어떻게 생각해?
en: What do you think about raising crayfish in the pond?

ko: 가재? 왜 갑자기 가재를 키우고 싶어진건데예..?
en: Crayfish? Why do you suddenly want to raise crayfish..?
Well they're red..
And they're red
Because they're red?

ko: 어무이 가재는 익혀야 색이 빨개지는 거 알지예?
en: Mom, crayfish only turn red when cooked, you know?
Weird… I definitely lost it here...
Spikey, what are you doing here?
Kyaaah!
Geez, why are you screaming!
S-sorry.. I didn't know it was you...

ko: 그래서 뭐 하고 있는데? 뭐 잃어뿟나.
en: So what are you doing? Did you lose something?

ko: 으응, 어제 여기 근처에서 소중한 걸 잃어버려서..
en: Yes, I lost something precious around here yesterday..
What is it?
..A pendant necklace.

ko: 내 귀걸이랑 같은 금색에, 좀 낡은..
en: The same gold color as my earrings, a bit old..
...Is that something you really treasure?
Huh? Yes.. it's something I've treasured since long ago.

ko: 니콜라스는 묵묵히 소매를 걷어붙이고, 덤불 속으로 들어간다.
en: Nicholas silently rolled up his sleeves and entered the bushes.
N-Nicholas..?

ko: 와 그라고 있노. 아끼는 거면 찾아야될 거 아이가.
en: Don't just stand there. If it's precious we need to find it.
Y-yes! Thank you…
Sigh… did you really drop it here?
Yes… this is the right place…
Sorry.. Nicholas, It's because of me...

ko: ㅇ,와 울고 그르노? 내 화낸거 아이다!
en: W-why are you crying? I'm not angry!

ko: 그치만, 목걸이를 잃어버린 것도, 니콜라스를 고생시킨 것도, 전부 나니까..
en: But I'm the one who lost the necklace, I'm the one who made Nicholas suffer, I'm the one who...

ko: 니는 쫌 사람이 말을 하면 똑띠 들어라.
en: You should listen carefully when someone is talking to you.
You're the one who lost it, but I'm the one who said I'd find it.
How is that your fault?

ko: 뭐든지 다 끌어안을라 카지 마라. 그런다꼬 아무도 안 알아준다.
en: Don't try to take responsibility for everything. Nobody will appreciate it even if you do.
… … … ciates it..
What?
You appreciates it.
…!! W-what are you saying?! When did I?!
Meow-

ko: ? 울 집서 밥 묵는 굉이가 와 여있노.
en: What’s that cat that always comes to my house for food doing here?
Oh, that..! My necklace!
Really?! Catch that cat!
Stop right there - !!
Ouch.. Nicholas, are you okay...?
Eh..?
Why are you two like this?
Oh, Mr. Wolfwood! That cat..!!

ko: 아~ 야가 또 뭘 물고 왔고 마.
en: Ah~ That one brought something again.

ko: 목걸이? 어서 째 빈 거 아이제? 안에 뭐가 든갑다.
en: A necklace? You didn’t steal it from somewhere, did you? There's something inside.
Oh, Mr. W-Wolfwood! Wait a sec...!

ko: 마.. 주인이 바로 앞에 있었구먼. 민망 하구로..
en: Well... The owner was right in front of me. How embarrassing..
Sorry for touching it without permission. Here, take it.

ko: 스탬피드는 울프우드의 손에서 펜던트를 낚아챈 뒤, 인사도 없이 사라졌다.
en: Stampede snatched the pendant from Wolfwood's hand and disappeared without saying goodbye.
Didn’t I say I’d help you?
W-what are you talking about?! Just give me the watering can!!!
Yeah yeah-

ko: (야들은 진도가 느린 건지 빠른 건지 모르겠구마.)
en: (Can’t tell if these kids are moving fast or taking it slow.)
Got the watering can from Wolfwood. Let's go back to Vash!
Nico~ Why did it take so long?
Did something happen on the way?
...Nothing happened. Here, I brought the watering can.
Thanks! It's completely fixed~
Should I water it now?

ko: 아, 사실 니코가 너무 안 와서…
en: Oh, actually, since you didn't come for so long...
I already watered them all!
………What?
The watering can is right here.. what did you use...??

ko: 아~ 찾아보니까, 창고에 하나 더 있더라고!
en: Ah~ I looked around and found another one in the storage!
Ehehe, sorry...~
..Well... it's fine... as long as you watered them... sigh...

ko: (너무 고생시켰나…? 그치만 어쩔 수 없지. 미안해, 니코…!)
en: (Did I make him suffer too much...? But I couldn't help it. Sorry, Nico...!)
Come on, come on~ Let's go home~

ko: 꽃밭이 넓게 펼쳐진 모습을 상상해 봐~ 황홀하지 않아?
en: Imagine a flower field spreading wide~ Isn't it enchanting?

ko: 오늘은 밥 값 하는구마. 상으로 빗자루한테 간식 달라하래이.
en: Today you earned your keep. Ask Spikey for some snacks as a reward.
Chopping firewood
Chopping firewood was father's job..
Aren’t they just going to dump the work on me?
Let's go to the forest first.
Let's find Wolfwood's axe in the forest

ko: 여 어디에 아부지가 쓰는 도끼가 있을긴데…
en: Father's axe should be somewhere around here...
Obtained [Old Axe].
The condition is a bit off...
It's used every day so it should be fine.
Now I need to find some trees.
Chopping trees in the forest
Alright, time to flex my muscles.
Press spacebar to hit the target

ko: 나무에 도끼질을 정확하게 하면 장작을 GET!
en: If you chop the tree accurately with the axe you GET firewood!
Whew~ It falls down nicely.

ko: 여는 더 쓸만한 나무가 없어 보이네.
en: There don't seem to be any more useful trees here.
Let's go to the next area.
Hmm.. my hand slipped.
It'll be different if I try again.

ko: 이 정도면 됐다. 집에서 제일 가까운 숲에서 패야 나르기 편한께 글로 가야겠다.
en: This should be enough. I should chop in the forest closest to home since it's easier to carry, so I'll go there.

ko: 후.. 안쪽 숲이라 그런가 나무가 억씨 고마..
en: Phew.. maybe because it's the inner forest the trees are really tough..

ko: 도끼의 손잡이가 부러지며 단면에 손이 긁혔다.
en: The axe handle broke and my hand got cut on the broken edge.
Argh..!!!
Damn... it's broken. I thought the handle seemed off.

ko: 피 봐라, 어무이한테 또 한소리 듣겄다…
en: Look at this blood, I'm going to get scolded by Vash again...
Nicholas?
Oh, Spikey. What are you doing here?
Uh-huh, picking blueberries...
Oh, Nicholas?! Your hand is bleeding..!
Are you okay?! The wound is too big...
Well... Just spit on it—it’ll be fine.

ko: 무슨 소리야! 그러다 더 크게 덧나!
en: What are you saying! It'll get infected even worse!

ko: (이래 큰소리 내는 건 또 첨 보네..)
en: (This is the first time I've seen him raise his voice like this..)
Y-yeah...
Give me your hand.

ko: 급하니까 소독은 집에 가서 하자. 일단 지혈부터…
en: It's urgent so let's disinfect it at home. Let's stop the bleeding...
I-it's fine. I'll handle it myself...!
Don't move. I need to tie it tightly.

ko: 스탬피드가 힘주어 니콜라스 손에 손수건을 묶어준다.
en: Stampede firmly ties a handkerchief around Nicholas's hand.

ko: …손수건이 이래가 우짜노. 내 하나 새로 사주께.
en: ...The handkerchief got ruined. I'll buy you a new one.

ko: 괜찮아. 피는 미지근한 물에 빨면 금방 빠지니까.
en: It's okay. Blood comes out quickly if I wash it with lukewarm water.
...When it's all healed, please come return it.
....Y-yeah.. ...I will.

ko: 스탬피드는 자신도 모르게 너무 바짝 달라붙었단 걸 깨닫고 얼굴이 붉어져 떨어진다.
en: Stampede realizes he got too close without knowing it and backs away with a red face.
T-then I'll be going now!
You need to go home and disinfect it properly!
This should be enough firewood.
I should probably get back to home.
It's Wolfwood's axe.

ko: 들고 다니는 게 귀찮은 지, 자주 여기에 두고 다니곤 한다.
en: Maybe because it's bothersome to carry around, he often leaves it here.
It looks like a quite sturdy tree.
Do you really want to cut down this tree?

ko: 세상에 안되는 게 어딨나! 남자는 근성과 맷집 아이겠나!!!
en: Nothing is impossible in this world! Isn't a man about grit and endurance!!!

ko: 아이 뭐, 굳이 사서 고생할 거 없지예.
en: Well, there's no need to make trouble for myself.
This little thing is nothing.

ko: 음, 이 뭐, 그거다. 도끼가 맛이 간기다.
en: Hmm, well, you know. The axe is acting up.
...For some reason, I don't want to go home right now.
(Some sounds can be heard from inside the house.)
I'm not going in.
Should I drink some water before going out?
Wolfwood~ Give it a try, ahhh~♥
I don't eat that stuff.

ko: 왜?! 한 입만 먹어봐, 이번엔 진짜 맛있게 됐다구!
en: Why?! Just try one bite, this time it really turned out delicious!
I don't need to eat it to know.

ko: 어제 밤에 묵은 게 더 맛나가…
en: What I ate last night was more delicious...
...?! What! Idiot! Perverted priest!
(Please stop the nonsense...)
Ahem, ahem...
N-Nico...~! What are you looking for? Should mom help you...?!
It's nothing. Please continue what you were doing.
Okay, you go get to work.

ko: ㄱ, 그런 거 아니야, 니코! 아, 쫌~!!!
en: I-it's not like that, Nico! Oh, come on~!!!
(Drinking water’s no big deal—what really worries me is I might end up with a little brother or sister…)
(I'll just have to drink pond water.)

ko: 울프우드! 너 니콜라스가 보고 있는 거 알고 있었지?!
en: Wolfwood! You knew Nicholas was watching, didn't you?!

ko: 왜 말 안 해줬어~!! 창피하단 말이야!!
en: Why didn't you tell me!! I'm so embarrassed!!
I like seeing you embarrassed
(Damn... disgusting couples...)
Really... will it be okay?
Yeah.
I'm satisfied with this.
Thank you, Spikey.
Come on, let's drink.
It's been a while since we drank together.
Smile, Spikey.
You look better...
...when you're smile.

ko: 텅 비었다는 식으로 말한 거 미안하다.
en: That was a bit harsh. Sorry.
Um...
Wolfwood... .
Please don't... say anything stupid...
I met a strange man.
Every time I start to feel as though he and I are finally on the same wavelength,

ko: 마음속 깊은 곳에선 꼭 의견이 갈렸다.
en: Our deepest thoughts inevitably pull us to opposite sides.
But I realized it then.

ko: 마음속 깊은 곳보다 더욱 깊은 곳에선
en: Even deeper than the depths of our hearts

ko: 이 남자와 내가 아주 많이 닮았다는 것을
en: this man and I were very much alike
Precious things, the will to protect them

ko: 때문에 모든 것을 이룬 다음의 하얀 백지를 이 사내와 같이 나누고 싶다고 생각했다.
en: Because of that, I wanted to share the blank white page after achieving everything with this man.
Oh God.
Please grant me just one wish.
Oh God ... … .
Stampede, it's been a while
Did you come to see Nicholas?
Mr. Wolfwood! How have you been?

ko: 니콜라스군이랑 함께 돌아오셨다고 들었어요! 건강히 돌아오셔서 얼마나 기쁜지 몰라요!
en: I heard you came back with Nico! I'm so happy you returned!

ko: 실례가 아니면 니콜라스랑 인사를 해도 될까요?
en: Would you mind if I said hello to Nicolas?
Yes, Spikey has been waiting only for you.

ko: 퍼뜩 드가봐봐라, 아 밥 묵고 있을 기다.
en: Go quickly, he's probably nursing right now.
Thank you! Mr. Wolfwood!
Why do you keep crying, Nico..

ko: 우유가 너무 뜨거운가? 흐음, 아닌 것 같은데.. 어떡하지…
en: Is the milk too hot? Hmm, doesn't seem like it.. what should I do...
Hello, Vash!

ko: 제가 혹시 안 좋은 타이밍에 온 걸까요..?
en: Did I come at a bad time..?
Oh, it's Stampede!
Huh, huh?
Nico suddenly smiled!
What? Why did he suddenly smile?
Vash looks back and forth between Nicholas and Stampede.
... No way..
…? (Just confused)

ko: 방금까진 니코가 울상이었는데, 스탬피드를 만나서 기분이 좋은가 봐!
en: Just now Nico was crying, but he seems happy to meet you!

ko: 정말요? 다행이에요. 니콜라스 군에게 잘 보이고 싶어서 아침부터 꾸몄거든요.
en: Really? That's good. I dressed up from the morning because I wanted to look good for Nico.
Hello Nico?

ko: 니콜라스는 다시 뚱해진 표정으로 스탬피드에게 앙증맞은 손을 뻗는다. 스탬피드와는 초면인데도 할 말이 많은 건지 작은 입도 우물거리면서 옹알인다.
en: Nicholas, with a pouty expression again, reaches out his cute little hand to Stampede. Even though it's his first time meeting Stampede, he seems to have a lot to say as his small mouth moves while babbling.
Stampede, if it's okay, would you like to hold Nico?
Yes?! Really..?

ko: 하, 하지만.. 아기는 안아본 적이 없는걸요.. 제가 안으면 니콜라스군이 불편할 거예요.
en: B-but.. I've never held a baby before.. Nicholas would be uncomfortable if I held him.

ko: 그렇지만 니코는 네가 마음에 든 것 같은데? 그러지 말고 한 번 안아줘~
en: But Nico seems to like you. Don't worry about it and just hold him once~

ko: 스탬피드는 밧슈로부터 조심스레 아기를 받아든다. 품 안에 들어온 니콜라스는 우유 냄새가 나는 뜨끈한 식빵 같았다.
en: Stampede carefully takes the baby from Vash. Nicholas in his arms was like warm bread that smelled of milk.

ko: 방금까지 울었던 게 거짓말인 것처럼. 스탬피드의 손을 잡고 의젓하게 옹알였다.
en: As if his crying just moments ago was a lie, he grabbed Stampede's hand and babbled dignifiedly.

ko: 와아… 왠지, 갑자기 눈물이 날 거 같아요…
en: Wow... somehow, I feel like I'm going to cry suddenly...

ko: 하하! 그거 봐, 아주 편해 보이잖아?
en: Haha! See, he looks very comfortable, doesn't he?
Nice to meet you, Nicholas..

ko: 이거 참, 스탬피드를 나보다 좋아하는 것 같아서 질투 날 정도인 걸.
en: Gee, it looks like he likes Stampede more than me, I'm almost jealous.
What if he says he wants to marry you?

ko: 아하핫, 빨리 커서 데리러 와야 해? 니콜라스군.
en: Ahaha, so you’d better hurry up and grow big, then come whisk me away as your bride, okay, Nico?
I'll wait..

ko: 부부의 침실에 함부로 들어가는 건 나쁜 행동이야!
en: It's bad to enter a married couple's bedroom carelessly!
This is Nicholas's room!

ko: 벽지는 무슨 색으로 하셨을까? 노란색? 분홍색?
en: I wonder what color they chose for the wallpaper—yellow? Pink?
Oh, so they had classic taste…
Chapter 1. Home, sweet home.
Is he still doing that?
Uh-huh.. it's been an hour already.
Sigh, it's frustrating..
Nico, do you have any worries?

ko: 안 봐도 뻔~하다. 너 또 스탬피드 생각하고 있지?
en: It's obvious without looking. You're thinking about Stampede again?

ko: 고민할 게 뭐가 있는데! 그냥 사나이답게 고백해라!
en: What's there to worry about! Just confess like a man!
Looks like love is in the air for him!

ko: 그래~! 아빠 말대로 고백 한번 해보는 건 어때~?
en: He's right! How about going for it and telling him how you feel—just like Dad said?

ko: 왜~ 너 어릴 때 그 아이만 매일 좋다고 따라다녔었잖니~
en: He's right! How about going for it and telling him how you feel—just like Dad said?

ko: 니콜라스는 대꾸 없이 액자를 탁자 위에 내려놓았다. 그리곤 특유의 뚱한 얼굴로 부모님을 바라본다
en: Nicholas put the picture frame down on the table without responding. Then he looks at his parents with his characteristic pouty face
Hmm, is this what they call 'puberty'?

ko: 점마는 사춘기가 아니라 그 짝사랑인지 뭔지 하는 주접이다.
en: Oh come on, that's not puberty, it's that one-sided love nonsense.

ko: 으이고 누굴 닮아 저래 문디 같은지..
en: Oh my, who does he take after to be so stubborn..

ko: 어, 어쨌든!! 아이가 힘들어할 때 도와주는 게 부모의 역할이잖아!!!
en: A-anyway!! It's the parent's role to help when the child is struggling!!!

ko: 아들이 저렇게 힘들어하면 도와줘야지! 안 도와줄 거야!?!
en: If our son is struggling like that, we should help him! Won't you help him?!?
Who said I wouldn't help?!
It's because that kid's behavior is frustrating.

ko: 그래서 빗자루. 뭐 좋은 생각이라도 있나?
en: So, Spikey. Do you have any good ideas?
Well.. I think,
… … (whisper whisper)
How about we do this?

ko: 좋네! 언제 이런 기발한 생각을 다했나!
en: Good! When did you come up with such a brilliant idea!
Then when should we start?
From today!! For Nico and our family..
Operation name: Love and Peace!!!!
Oh, Nicholas!
The weather is really nice today!
Where are you going? Parents' errand?
..I'm going to uncle's house.
Are you going to help with work?

ko: 후후, 기특하네. 힘들지 않겠어? 내가 도와줄 일 없을까?
en: Hehe, how admirable. Won't it be hard? Is there anything I can help with?
(How long will I be treated like a kid...)

ko: … 됐다. 내가 얼라도 아이고. 신경 끄라.
en: … It's fine. I'm not a kid. Don't mind me.
Ah... that's right, sorry.

ko: 그럼 다음에 보자, 니콜라스. 오늘 일 힘내!
en: Then see you next time, Nicholas. Good luck with work today!
Sigh...

ko: (얼라가 아이긴 뭐가 아이고. 완전 얼라다. 그것도 아주 엄살궂은.)
en: (What do you mean I'm not a kid. I'm totally a kid. A very whiny one at that.)

ko: 이런 놈이 남자로 보이믄 눈이 아이고 눈깔 이제. 맞재..
en: If someone like this looks like a man then they must be blind. Right..
Should I sleep first and think about it tomorrow..?
In the blink of an eye it's morning..

ko: 그러고 보니 심부름 종이를 어디 뒀쟤?
en: Come to think of it where did I put the errand note?
It's a grave of unknown identity

ko: 예전에 밧슈에게 누구의 무덤인지 물어보았는데, 지금은 쓰지 않는다고 한다..
en: I asked Vash before whose grave it was, but he said it's not used anymore..

ko: 오늘은 숲에 딱히 볼 일이 없다.
en: There's nothing particular to see in the forest today.
It's not time to go to Stampede's house.
I don't want to go home right now..

ko: Chapter 2. Never give up! Never surrender!
en: Chapter 2. Never give up! Never surrender!
Chapter 3. Count Down
Chapter 4. A ticket to the future
Uncle, have you been well?
Nicholas! Welcome-!!
Geez, you're going to make me go deaf..
Ahaha, because...

ko: 이제 다 컸다고 예전처럼 자주 와주지 않으니까…
en: Now that you're all grown up, you don't come visit often like before...

ko: 은제적 얘길 하는깁니꺼. 거 내 다슷살 때 입니더.
en: You're talking about old times. That was when I was five years old.
To uncle it feels like just yesterday..
People often say that’s what happens when you get older
Give me the knife.
Livio handed over the woodworking knife

ko: 손이 커져서 그런가? 이제 훨씬 깔끔하게 만드는걸!
en: Is it because your hands got bigger? Now you make it much more neatly!
Well... only my body grew like that.
Why are you looking at me like that..?

ko: 리비오는 니콜라스에게만 보여주는 짖궂은 얼굴로 입가를 당겨 웃는다.
en: Livio pulls the corners of his mouth and smiles with a mischievous face that he only shows to Nicholas.
Nicholas, you have some worries, don't you?
..There's nothing like that.

ko: 하지만 네가 만든 새 날개, 한쪽이 더 작게 깎였는데?
en: But the bird wing you made, one side is carved smaller than the other?

ko: 그리고 공방에 올 때는 항상 진정하고 싶을 때였잖아.
en: And whenever you come to the workshop it's always when you want to calm down.
Was it the day you got scolded badly by your dad for the first time?
You carved a bird then too. It was a mess though!

ko: 10년도 더 된 일 아입니꺼. 고마 하이소..
en: That was more than 10 years ago. Please stop it..

ko: 그래도, 니콜라스는 그때 나 지금이나 항상 내 귀여운 조카니까 말이야!
en: Still, Nicholas is always my cute nephew, whether then or now!

ko: …아무리 나이를 무도 얼라는 얼라, 이 말임니꺼!
en: ...What, so I’m still just a kid no matter how old I get?!

ko: 니콜라스는 언성을 높이며 자리를 박차고 일어났다가, 머쓱하니 의자에 주저앉았다.
en: Nicholas raised his voice and stood up abruptly, then awkwardly sat back down on the chair.

ko: 맞아, 그러니까 혼자서 끌어안기보단 조금은 어리광 부리면 어때?
en: That's right, so instead of bearing it all alone, how about acting a little spoiled?
That's the privilege of being young!
... Right, let me think about that.

ko: 니콜라스는 한결 가벼워진 마음으로 조각을 깎아나간다.
en: Nicholas carves the sculpture with a much lighter heart.

ko: 가장 좋아하는 이의 웃는 얼굴을 떠올리면서…
en: While thinking of his loving person's smiling face...

ko: 날이 어둑해질 즘엔 그럴듯한 새 조각이 완성되었다.
en: By the time it got dark a decent bird sculpture was completed.

ko: 밖이 깜깜해졌네. 너무 늦게까지 붙잡고 있었다고 형한테 혼나겠는걸?
en: It's gotten dark outside. Won't you get scolded by your brother for keeping you too late?
I should be going now.

ko: 그래~ 오늘도 고생했어. 또 고민이 있으면 언제든 찾아와!
en: Alright~ You worked hard today too. Come visit anytime if you have worries again!

ko: 니콜라스? 혹시 나에게 상담하고 싶은 게 있어?
en: Nicholas? Do you happen to have something you want to consult me about?

ko: (언젠가 이렇게 멋진 삼촌 역할을 하는 날이 오기만을 기다렸지)
en: (I've been waiting for the day when I could play such a cool uncle role like this)
Livio cannot hide his anticipation.

ko: (역시 이런 건 커플에게 물어보는 게 낫겠지?)
en: (I guess it's better to ask a couple about things like this.)
No. Thank you for today.
Well, alright...
Nico~!
Where have you been?! It's dark outside

ko: 내비 도라. 쟈는 도둑을 만나도 통째로 잡아올 텐데.
en: Let him be. He’s the kind of kid who’d nab a thief and drag him back alive.
... I'm back.
Son. Come here.

ko: 니 먼 고민 있나? 며칠째 세상 망한 것 마냥 우중충해 다니지 않나.
en: Do you have some worries? You've been looking gloomy for days like the world has ended.
Father. Mother.
Yes, Nico!
Earlier... about that confession you mentioned.
How should I do it?

ko: 아부지 어무이도 커플이니까… 그런 거 잘 알지예…?
en: Since father and mother are a couple... you know about these things well, right?

ko: 하모, 니 어무이랑 내랑은 지지고 볶고 다해봐 연애는 도사지.
en: Well, your mother and I have been through it all - we're experts at romance.
But ...
Just with words?
Where in the world is there anything for free?

ko: 원래 부모 자식 간이 셈을 가장 잘치뤄야 하는 기다.
en: Parents and children should settle accounts the best.

ko: 여 적힌 거 다 해뿌면 그때 니 연애 도와주마.
en: Do everything written here, then I'll help you with your love life.
Nicholas received the paper note that Wolfwood handed him.

ko: (기냥 건수 잡아가 조뺑이 시키는 거 아이가?)
en: (Isn't he just finding an excuse to make me do chores?)

ko: 오늘은 늦었으니까, 이만 자고 내일부터 부탁해~!
en: It's late today, so go to sleep and start tomorrow!

ko: 그래. 퍼뜩 가서 자라. 새벽같이 인나야 밤에는 다 끝내재.
en: Yeah. Go to bed quickly. You need to get up early to finish everything by night.
(I feel like he's scheming something, uncle...?)
There's a mountain of work to do.
What should I start with...
Now it's all finished...
You finished everything! Great job, Nico~

ko: 연애하고 잡는 놈이 이 정도는 해야지.
en: Someone who wants to date should do at least this much.

ko: 이제 더 할 일은 없는 거지 예?
en: There's nothing more to do now?

ko: 다 했으니 이제 가장 중요한 고백 준비를 해야지!
en: All the other tasks are done, so now it’s time to get ready for the most important part—telling stampede how you feel!

ko: 프러포즈의 정석인 꽃과 반지를 준비하는 거야.
en: We need to prepare flowers and a ring - the basics of a proposal.

ko: 꽃은 니코가 직접 키운 제라늄을 주면 되고
en: For the flowers, just give him the geraniums you grew yourself.

ko: 반지는 역시 직접 제작해서 주는 게 좋겠지?
en: And it would be best to make the ring yourself too?

ko: 그래서 내보고 나무하고, 제라늄 키우라 한 거가!?
en: So that's why you made me chop wood and grow geraniums!?
You're just realizing this now.
You're still far from being ready.
Go and work harder!!!
Oh come on!!!
Scrape, scrape.

ko: 늘 나무 새를 조각하던 니콜라스의 손이 오늘은 반지를 깎고 있다.
en: Nicholas's hands that usually carved wooden birds are carving a ring today.
...By the way, I don't even know Spikey's ring size.

ko: 하… 이리 중한 걸 내는 인제서야.. 미치겄다.
en: Sigh... I'm just realizing something this important now... I'm going crazy.
Are you preparing well~?
I'm screwed. I’m sure I’ll get turned down flat when I confess my feelings.
Then I’ll end up flat as a pancake…
What’s with you? You look like you want the ground to swallow you up.
...I don't know Spikey's ring size.
You haven’t even held his hand yet?
I don't want to hear that from you.
...Don’t rub salt in the wound.

ko: 어쨌든, 사내가 고작 그딴 걸로 죽상을 쓰고 그라나.
en: Anyway, a man shouldn't look so miserable over something like that.
Here, take this.

ko: 울프우드는 작은 상자에서 반지 하나를 꺼냈다.
en: Wolfwood took out a ring from a small box.
What is this?
Your mother's ring.
I've never seen him wear it.
Well, I haven't given it to him yet.
…What exactly did you do on your wedding day?
Men have their own reasons.

ko: 갸 손을 보아하니, 니 엄마랑 비슷하다 카이.
en: Looking at his hands, they're similar to your mother's.
If you resize this roughly it should fit.
Okay, thank you.
Don't be too grateful.

ko: 울프우드는 니콜라스의 어깨를 두드린 뒤, 자리에서 일어났다.
en: Wolfwood patted Nicholas's shoulder, then got up from his seat.
...A wedding ring, huh...

ko: 니콜라스는 낯선 반지를 손 위에 올려 이리저리 살펴보았다.
en: Nicholas placed the unfamiliar ring on his hand and examined it from all angles.
...I want to put it on Spikey soon too.
Should I get some fresh air...

ko: 이 새벽엔 꽃 밭에 아무도 없겠지.
en: There should be no one in the flower field at this dawn.
A cool night breeze blows from the river.

ko: 어느새 몽우리가 진 제라늄이 바람에 산들산들 흔들리고 있다.
en: The geraniums that have formed buds are swaying gently in the wind.

ko: ? 이게 벌써 꽃이 필라 카네. 벨 일이 다 있다…
en: These are already about to bloom. All sorts of things happen...

ko: 오늘 심는다고 당장 자라서 꽃이 피진 않겠지만..
en: Just because I planted them today doesn't mean they'll grow and bloom right away..

ko: 혹시 모르지, 니코의 사랑을 담는다면 기적이 일어날지도?
en: Who knows, maybe a miracle will happen if you put your love into it?
A miracle...
How wonderful it would be if it were real.
Just having my love acknowledged would be a miracle.
But I won't just wait around.
I want to give him the present and say just the right words—
so I can make him smile.
I’ll tell you you’re the one I love most—

ko: 내가 제일 좋아하는 얼굴 한 번만 보여도.
en: So please, just once, show me that face I adore more than anything.
...I'd be fine with that.
…What do you mean fine!!!!!!!!!

ko: 고 사이 딴 놈이 채가면 우짤라카는데?
en: What if someone else takes him in the meantime?
No, what if he's already dating someone...?

ko: 내는 그렇다 쳐도, 쟈는 이미 혼기도 찼다카이!
en: Never mind me, but he's already at marriageable age!
Then it's all for nothing!!!
Quickly, grow quickly!!! Please!!!!!!!!!

ko: 평화로운 나날 어느덧 날짜는 7월 18일을 가리키고 있다.
en: In the peaceful days the date has already reached July 18st.

ko: 들판 너머, 니콜라스가 정성을 다해 가꾼 제라늄도 어느덧 꽃 몽우리가 피어날 준비를 하고 있다.
en: Beyond the fields, the geraniums that Nicholas carefully tended are also ready to bloom.

ko: 제라늄이 활짝 피는 날을 기준으로, 스탬피드에게 고백하는 상상을 괜스레 해보는 니콜라스다.
en: Nicholas imagines confessing to Stampede on the day when the geraniums bloom fully.

ko: 꽃이 만개한 제라늄 들판에 바람이 휘날린다.
en: Wind swirls through the geranium field in full bloom.
I've only loved you since I was young.
Please accept my feelings...!!
Nico...
I'm truly happy.
I also... love you.
Flower petals scatter on the sweet breeze.

ko: 서툴지만 진실한 방식으로 서로의 마음을 확인한 두 사람.
en: The two of them, clumsy yet sincere, finally affirmed each other’s feelings.

ko: 마주하는 것만으로도 떨리는 눈을 서로에게 마주한 채
en: With trembling eyes that flutter just from facing each other
Holding hands and their lips...
I must be crazy. I'm not even a kid...!!!!
...I should go out and thin the flowers.
Nico!!!!! This is no time for this!!
Stampede...! Stampede is leaving today...!!

ko: 짐도 벌써 다 실어서 갈 준비를…
en: He's already packed everything and is ready to go...
What!?
He's leaving?! Where to?!
He's going to July City to follow his brother...

ko: 내는… 내는 아직 좋아한다고… 말도 못 했는데…!!
en: I... I haven't even told him I love him yet...!!
Did he go?
Yes. he ran off with an urgent expression.
…Will he be okay?
It depends on what he does.
Wait and see
The path he needs to take is for him to decide.
We just... need to watch over him.
I have to tell him how I feel before he leaves...!!
Time remaining until Stampede leaves is 3 minutes...!

ko: 고백을 위해 준비했던, [제라늄 꽃]과 [반지]를 준비해서 스탬피드를 만나야 해!
en: I need to prepare the [Geranium Flower] and [Ring] that I prepared for the confession and meet Stampede!
Prepare the geranium flower

ko: 꽃을 준비하지 않고선 스탬피드를 만날 수 없어!
en: I can't meet Stampede without preparing the flower!

ko: 바람이 솔솔 부는 들판인지라, 어느새 제라늄 말고도 다른 꽃들이 많이 자리를 잡았다.
en: Since the wind blows gently through the field, many other flowers besides geraniums have settled in.

ko: 으아아악…!! 이 중에 제라늄이 있을 텐데…? 대체 어떤 거지?!
en: Ahhh...!! There must be geraniums among these...? Which ones are they?!
Damn, this must be the right one?!
Nicholas vigorously plucked the flower!

ko: 자세히 보니 제라늄과 비슷한 꽃이었다. 임파첸스… 였었나?
en: Looking closely it was a flower similar to geranium. Was it Impatiens...?

ko: 자세히 보니 제라늄과 비슷한 꽃이었다. 홑겹 장미…였었나…?
en: Looking closely it was a flower similar to geranium. Was it a Single rose...?

ko: 자세히 보니 제라늄과 비슷한 꽃이었다. 베고니아… 였었나?
en: Looking closely it was a flower similar to geranium. Was it Begonia...?

ko: 니콜라스는 제라늄을 정확히 알아봤다! 이게 다 밧슈의 교육 덕분인 걸까?!
en: Nicholas correctly identified the geranium! Is this all thanks to Vash's education?!
Nicholas threw away the unfamiliar flower!!!

ko: 머꼬, 왠 잡초가 끼어 든기고?!! 제라늄은 어딨는기가?!
en: What, why are there weeds mixed in?!! Where are the geraniums?!

ko: 휴, 꽃은 챙겼고. 이제 반지만 찾으면 된다…!!
en: Phew, I got the flower. Now I just need to find the ring...!!

ko: 저번에 옷 주머니에 넣어놨던건  기억이 나는데…
en: I remember putting it in my clothes pocket last time...

ko: 일단 방으로 가자!! 가면 기억이 나겠쟤!!
en: Let's go to my room first!! I'll remember when I get there!!

ko: 방에 도착한 니콜라스는 정작 어떤 옷에서 반지를 찾아야 할지 몰라 혼돈에 빠졌다!
en: Nicholas arrived at his room but fell into confusion not knowing which clothes to search for the ring!

ko: 아 그러니까… 내가 그날 뭘 입었지…?!
en: Oh right... what did I wear that day...?!
I think it was the black clothes...
This isn’t the right outfit…
I found the ring in the pocket...!!
Ah, the ring... was it here?!!!

ko: 앞으론 입은 옷은 재깍 재깍 치워야겠데이…
en: From now on I should put away the clothes I’ve worn more neatly...
There seems to be something in the pocket...
All set...!!
Both the ring and flower are ready...!
Now I just need to go meet Spikey...!!!

ko: 제한 시간이 끝나기 전에 스탬피드를 만나러 가자!
en: Let's go meet Stampede before time runs out!

ko: 너무 늦으면 스탬피드가 떠나버릴지도 모른다…! 서둘러야 해…!
en: If I'm too late Stampede might leave...! I need to hurry...!

ko: 으아아악…!! 머꼬!! 왜 나무가 여기 쓰러져 있는 기가?!!
en: Ahhh...!! What the—?! Why is there a tree fallen here?!!

ko: 급해 죽겠는데…. 어쩔 수 없지! 뿌쑤고 지나간다…!!!
en: I’m in such a rush.... Can't help it! I'll break through...!!!
Press [spacebar] to break the tree and pass through!

ko: 제한 시간 내에 나무를 부수면 성공!
en: Success if you break the tree within the time limit!

ko: 헉,헉…. 별것도 아닌 게, 앞 길을 막고 있어…!!
en: Huff, huff... Something so trivial is blocking the way...!!
Wait! Spikey! I'm coming right now...!!

ko: 제길, 다시!! 이딴 걸로 포기할 순 없데이…! 다시 해보자!!!
en: Damn, again!! I can't give up over something like this...! Let's try again!!!
Spikey-!!!
A stray dog has crawled in.
Huff... huff, get out of the way.

ko: 지금 그쪽이랑 말장난할 시간 따위 없심더.
en: I don't have time to play word games with you right now.

ko: 제 앞가림도 못하는 놈에게 들을 말은 없다.
en: I have nothing to hear from someone who can't even take care of himself.
Knives, I'm all ready~

ko: 앗 니코..?! 둘이 왜 그러고 있어?
en: Oh Nico..?! Why are you two like this?
It's nothing. Give me the luggage.

ko: 응 여기. 고마워 다음에 놀러 올 거지?
en: Here you go. Thanks. Will you come visit?
I'll think about it.
I'll kill you if you do anything foolish.

ko: 니코..? 여기까지 뛰어온 거야? 숨찬 것 같은데 괜찮아..?
en: Nico..? Did you run all the way here? You look out of breath..
Are you moving today..?

ko: 어..? 으응.. 맞아. 그래서 나이가 도와주러-
en: Huh..? Yeah.. that's right. So Knives came to help-
Don't you trust me...?!
Why..! You didn't even tell me…!!

ko: 초조했던 마음이 터져 나오듯 목소리가 높아졌던 니콜라스는 얼어붙은 스탬피드를 보고 입을 다문다.
en: Nicholas’s voice rose, his anxiety spilling over, but he fell silent at Stampede’s frozen expression.

ko: (아냐. 저런 표정을 짓게 만들고 싶었던 게 아닌데..)
en: (No. I didn’t mean to make you look like that...)

ko: 숨이 목 끝까지 차오르고, 심장이 터질 것 같아도..
en: Even though my breath rises to my throat and my heart feels like it's going to burst...

ko: 다리를 움직여 달려와서 전하고 싶었던 말은..!
en: The words I wanted to say after moving my legs and running here are..!

ko: 니콜라스는 손에 들고 있던 제라늄을 불쑥 들이민다.
en: Nicholas suddenly thrust forward the geranium he was holding in his hand.

ko: 급히 달려온 탓에 줄기가 군데군데 꺾여있고, 조금이나마 피어있던 꽃들은 꽃잎이 날려 성치 않다.
en: Because of rushing here the stems are broken in places and the few flowers that were blooming have their petals blown away and are not intact.
…I can't say pretty words like others.

ko: 말도 등신처럼 하고 니한테 상처만 주는 놈이라 별로겠재..
en: I speak like an idiot and only hurt you so you probably don't like me..
Nicholas…?
I don't even know what I'm saying!!!

ko: 니는 어떨지 모르겠지만 내가 하고 싶은 말은..
en: I don't know how you feel but what I want to say is..
I wish you wouldn't go.
I wish you would stay by my side…

ko: 빗자루, 니 안 가믄 안 되나..?
en: Spikey can't you not go..?
... I love you. Don't go.
(I wanted to confess to him in style…)

ko: 니콜라스는 모든 것 망쳤음을 직감적으로 깨달았다.
en: Nicholas intuitively realized that he had ruined everything.

ko: 그의 볼품없는 고백에 실망한 탓일까. 스탬피드는 아무 말 없이 니콜라스를 바라본다.
en: Perhaps disappointed by his shabby confession, Stampede looks at Nicholas without saying anything.
Stampede accepted the bouquet that Nicholas handed to him.
…It feels like yesterday when you were in my arms..
You probably don't remember because you were young Nico but..
When you were little you said you would marry me
Back then I thought it was just a child's whim..
But when did you grow up like this and to me...

ko: 니콜라스는 춤을 청하듯 스탬피드의 손을 자신의 손 위에 올렸다.
en: Nicholas placed Stampede's hand on his own as if asking for a dance.

ko: 어째서인지, 허겁지겁 달렸던 방금 보다 지금 더 심장이 뛰는 것 같다.
en: For some reason my heart seems to be beating faster now than when I was running frantically just now.

ko: 주머니 안쪽에 소중히 보관한 나무 반지를 꺼내 스탬피드 손에 끼워준다.
en: He takes out the wooden ring he had carefully kept in his pocket and puts it on Stampede's hand.

ko: … 니코. 후회할 것 같으면, 아직 그만둬도 돼.
en: …Nico. If you think you'll regret it you can still stop.
I won't say anything twice.

ko: 니도 내도. 이젠 무르고 싶어도 못 무르는 거래이.
en: You and I both. Now we can't take it back even if we want to.

ko: 응! 너도 나중에 딴소리하면 안 돼?
en: Yes! And you’d better not change your tune later! okay?

ko: 스탬피드는 제라늄처럼 발개진 코를 훌쩍이고 꽃다발을 와락 끌어안는다.
en: Stampede sniffles with his nose red like a geranium and hugs the bouquet tightly.
Hehe the flowers smell nice~
Um.. by any chance..

ko: 니만 괜찮으면 우리 집으로 오는건 어때?
en: If you're okay with it how about coming to our house?

ko: 우리 집에 빈 방 하나 있어가..
en: We have one empty room in our house..

ko: 물론 정리는 쪼매 해야 하지만, 니 오면 내가 광나게 닦아놓을게.
en: Of course I need to clean up a bit but if you come I'll polish it until it shines.

ko: 우리 집에 살면..! 내가 키운 제라늄들 맨날 볼 수 있다. 그리고, 내도…
en: If you live in our house..! You can see the geraniums I grew every day. And I also…
…Yes?

ko: 저기, 니콜라스.. 아까부터 뭔가 이상한 것 같아서.
en: Um Nicholas.. something seems strange since earlier.

ko: 나 니코네 집으로 이사 가는 건데?
en: I'm moving to Nico's house.
Huh? Didn't your parents tell you?

ko: 혼자 있기엔 집에 너무 큰 것 같아서 고민이었거든!
en: My house seemed too big for me to live alone so I was worried!

ko: 그런데 울프우드씨가 빈 방이 하나 있다고, 얼른 들어오라고 하셨어.
en: But Mr. Wolfwood said there's one empty room and told me to come in quickly.

ko: 지금 짐 싸서 리비오씨를 부르려는 참이었는데..
en: I was just about to pack my things and call Mr. Livio..
(Damn it… Father..!!)
I'll help you with your romance.

ko: 순간 자신의 부모님이 머릿속에서 껄껄 웃으며 주마등처럼 스쳐 지나간다.
en: For a moment his parents pass through his mind like a panorama laughing heartily.
I don't really know what happened but..

ko: 그래도 앞으로 니코랑 같이 지낼 수 있어서 좋아.
en: But I'm happy that I can live with Nico from now on.
I'm really happy that you kept your promise.
I'm happy too..

ko: 그렇게 두 사람의 이야기는 끝나지 않고 계속된다.
en: Thus the story of the two continues without ending.

ko: 누군가의 간절했던 기도가 푸른 하늘에 닿아
en: Someone's earnest prayer reaches the blue sky
As if their wish was granted

ko: 더 이상 이 세상에 눈물 흘리는 이가 없기를
en: May there be no more tears in this world

ko: 사랑하는 이를 두고 홀로 떠나는 이가 없기를
en: May there be no one who leaves alone leaving their loved one behind
May endless blessings be full before the lovers…
I’m glad they were able to express their feelings honestly!
I told you.
This 'life' will be without any problems

ko: ..푸흐 그렇네! 이번엔 정말 별일 없어서 다행이야.
en: That's right! I'm glad nothing really happened this time.
Wolfwood and the children too!

ko: 우리가 멀쩡하니 또 다른 '우리'도 괜찮은 게 당연한 거재.
en: Since we're fine it's natural that another 'us' is also okay.
Spikey. I also have something to give you.

ko: 울프우드는 품 속에서 나무 반지를 꺼낸다.
